intro: Linaria benitoi, commonly known as the Benito's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged opposite along the stem, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Linaria benitoi is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
